description: Selects rows, based on position, from a datatable

input.name: data
input.description: The datatable containing the rows to be selected.

input.name: begin
input.description:
The position of the first row to be selected.
 A negative number can be used to count from the end of the datatable (e.g. '-5' would start at the fifth-to-last row).
 If unspecified, defaults to '1' (first row of the datatable)

input.name: end
input.description:
The position of the last row to be selected.
A negative number can be used to count from the end of the datatable.
If unspecified, defaults to `-1` (the last row in the datatable).

input.name: limit
input.description:
A positive number specifying a limit on the number of rows to be selected.
If unspecified, no limit will be applied.

output.name: data
output.description: A datatable containing the selected rows.
